intro: Centaurea debeauxii var. minima, commonly known as the dwarf French knapweed, is a small perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple or reddish center, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value.
